Solar energy for a semi-detached house on a flat roof.
descdettailed:
In Paderno Dugnano (MI), a solar energy project was completed for a two-family building. Two separate photovoltaic systems were installed, one for each residential unit, to help meet their respective energy needs.

The first system has a capacity of 4.92 kWp, with an estimated annual production of approximately 5,215 kWh. The second, more powerful system reaches 6.56 kWp, for an estimated annual production of approximately 6,954 kWh. Overall, the two systems contribute significantly to the building's clean energy supply.

The photovoltaic modules were installed on the building's flat roof, using specific support structures, some of which were ballasted, to ensure stability and optimize integration with the existing structure.

Tipologia Description: Solar energy for a new home, ready to run an induction hob and air conditioning.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Solar Energy for a New Life in Sesto Ulteriano: Efficiency and Future-Proof

Text:

When Mr. Beleggia purchased his new single-family home in Sesto Ulteriano, just outside Milan, he had a clear goal: to make it energy efficient from the start, especially considering the installation of modern, energy-intensive appliances such as an induction hob and air conditioning.

To meet this requirement, Myenergy designed and installed a custom 4.92 kWp photovoltaic system, composed of 12 high-efficiency panels. The solution was designed not only to maximize clean energy production and immediately reduce energy bills, but also to look to the future.

The system is equipped with a latest-generation Goodwe hybrid inverter. This technology makes the system "Battery-Ready": the customer can easily integrate a storage system in the future, should they wish, to further increase their energy independence and take advantage of solar energy even during the evening hours. Power optimizers were also used to ensure the best possible performance from the system. 

Thanks to this installation, Mr. Beleggia's new home can count on an estimated annual production of approximately 5,215 kWh of clean energy, covering a significant portion of the family's consumption and contributing to considerable savings on utility bills (estimated at approximately €39,190 over 25 years, combining energy savings and the 50% tax deduction as per the offer terms). It is also estimated that over 25 years, the system will prevent the emission of approximately 33 tons of CO2 into the atmosphere and will have a positive impact equivalent to planting 150 trees. The choice of direct purchase and the simplicity of electronic signature made the process quick and easy, allowing the customer to start enjoying solar energy in their new home in the shortest possible time. A smart investment for a modern, efficient home that can evolve over time.

Tipologia Description: Residential system with battery and backup in the province of Pavia: solar energy, continuity, and 5 years of maintenance included.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Solar Energy with Storage and Backup: Efficiency and Safety for a Home in the Province of Pavia

Text:

For a single-family home located in the province of Pavia, Myenergy has created a comprehensive energy solution, aimed not only at savings but also at ensuring the safety and continuity of the electricity supply. A 6.15 kWp photovoltaic system was installed, consisting of 15 modules positioned on the building's pitched roof.

The system is combined with a 5.1 kWh storage battery, which allows excess solar energy produced during the day to be stored for use in the evening or night, thus maximizing self-consumption.

A key feature of this system is the inclusion of a backup (or anti-blackout) function. In the event of a national grid outage, the system can continue to power the home's essential loads using the energy stored in the battery, ensuring comfort and operation even in times of grid failure.

For added peace of mind, the offer includes a five-year maintenance package, which includes annual checks to ensure the system maintains optimal performance over time. 

With an estimated annual production of approximately 6,519 kWh of clean energy, this system allows for significant energy cost savings (estimated at nearly €43,000 over 25 years, considering savings and incentives), while also reducing environmental impact by approximately 41.6 tons of CO2 (equivalent to planting 254 trees). A comprehensive solution that combines efficiency, savings, and energy security.

Tipologia Description: Double PV upgrade with BYD storage and Goodwe inverter, Superbonus with quick connection.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Superbonus Upgrade in Paderno Dugnano: Two PV Systems with BYD Storage

Text:

In Paderno Dugnano (MI), Myenergy managed a major energy retrofit project for a home, replacing an existing photovoltaic system with two new, independent, technologically advanced systems equipped with storage, one for each unit served (registered to Danilo and Elvira Patalfi). The project was completed under the Superbonus incentives.

The first system (Danilo Patalfi) was configured with 12 photovoltaic panels for a power output of 4.92 kWp, combined with a Goodwe 6000EH hybrid inverter and a high-performance BYD 8.28 kWh storage system. A 7.4 kW wallbox was installed for convenient home charging of electric vehicles.

The second system (Elvira Patalfi), sized for larger needs, features 15 photovoltaic panels with a power output of 6.15 kWp, also equipped with a Goodwe 6000EH hybrid inverter and supported by a large 10.24 kWh BYD storage system.

Both systems were designed to ensure high energy autonomy thanks to their high-capacity batteries. The project was completed within the required timeframe to allow customers to access the Superbonus incentives.

The project also includes three years of routine maintenance, and as a small gesture for sustainability, customers were given the opportunity to adopt a beehive through 3Bee.

With an estimated combined annual production of approximately 11,600 kWh, these systems not only reduce energy costs but also provide clean, reliable energy to the home, avoiding the emission of approximately 74 tons of CO2 over 25 years (equivalent to the energy produced by 453 trees).

Tipologia Description: Double PV upgrade with BYD storage and Goodwe inverter, Superbonus with quick connection.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Superbonus Upgrade in Paderno Dugnano: Two PV Systems with BYD Storage

Text:

In Paderno Dugnano (MI), Myenergy managed a major energy retrofit project for a home, replacing an existing photovoltaic system with two new, independent, technologically advanced systems equipped with storage, one for each unit served. The project was completed under the Superbonus incentives.

Tipologia Description: Photovoltaic and storage for a 100% electric and sustainable single-family home.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Fully Electric Renovation in Bernate Ticino: Energy Independence with Photovoltaic and Three-Phase Storage

Text:

As part of a complete renovation of his single-family home in Bernate Ticino (MI), Mr. Cimolato pursued an ambitious vision: transforming it into a modern, efficient, and fully electric home, powered by a heat pump, air conditioning, and an induction hob. This choice required a worthy energy solution.

Myenergy took up the challenge, designing a powerful and integrated photovoltaic system capable of supporting the home's significant energy needs. Taking into account the site's characteristics, such as the presence of shade on part of the roof, the 8.3 kWp system, composed of 20 high-efficiency panels installed with a partially integrated system, was optimized by positioning it on the slope with the best solar exposure.

The heart of the system is a 6kW Huawei SUN2000 three-phase hybrid inverter, combined with a 10kWh Huawei LUNA2000 storage system. This combination ensures not only high production during the day, but also the ability to store excess solar energy for use at night or during peak appliance consumption, maximizing self-consumption and grid independence.

The installation was perfectly integrated with the other ongoing renovation projects. Thanks to careful planning and close collaboration with the project management and other contractors on site, the photovoltaic system was seamlessly integrated into the overall project, on time and on schedule. The system was also perfectly adapted to the home's new three-phase electricity supply, ensuring compatibility and optimal performance.

Thanks to this turnkey solution, Mr. Cimolato can enjoy the benefits of a fully electric home without worrying about energy costs. The plant is capable of producing approximately 8,692 kWh of clean energy annually, generating estimated savings of over €64,000 over 25 years (including savings, net metering, and a 50% tax deduction) and avoiding the emission of approximately 55 tons of CO2, with an environmental benefit equivalent to planting 150 trees. A decisive step toward efficiency and sustainability, supported by cutting-edge technology and integrated construction site management.

Tipologia Description: System near Ticino Park: Photovoltaic system with ZCS storage for the efficiency of a two-family house
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Solar Efficiency in Vigevano: System with Storage for a Two-Family Home

Text:

For a two-family home in Vigevano, located near the picturesque Ticino Park, Myenergy designed a customized solution to optimize energy autonomy and reduce significant household consumption.

A 6.15 kWp photovoltaic system was installed, consisting of 15 high-efficiency modules, perfectly integrated into the home's tiled roof. The heart of the system is a ZCS hybrid inverter, chosen for its reliability and ability to manage energy flows, combined with a 5.1 kWh ZCS storage system. This configuration allows for the storage of solar energy produced but not immediately consumed, making it available during the evening hours or on less sunny days, thus maximizing self-consumption.

A detail that highlights the meticulous attention to detail in the installation is the use of copper piping to run electrical cables from the system to the utility rooms, ensuring a solution that is not only efficient but also aesthetically pleasing. 

With an estimated annual production of nearly 6,600 kWh, the system covers a significant portion of the home's energy needs, drastically reducing utility bills and environmental impact. It is estimated to save approximately 42 tons of CO2 over 25 years, the equivalent of planting 257 trees. The project includes two years of routine maintenance to ensure consistent performance over time. A conscious choice for a more sustainable future in the heart of Pavia.

Tipologia Description: 8.8 kWp PV system with ZCS All-in-One storage and Tigo optimizers for high consumption, results beyond expectations.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Maximum Efficiency in Desio (MB): 8.8 kWp System with Optimized All-in-One Storage

Text:

For a single-family home in Desio (MB) characterized by significant energy consumption (approximately 11 MWh per year) and a potentially complex roof, Myenergy designed and installed a high-power photovoltaic solution, aimed at maximizing autonomy and savings.

The installed system has a peak power of 8.8 kWp, generated by 20 photovoltaic modules. The heart of the system is a ZCS All-in-One solution, which compactly integrates both the single-phase hybrid inverter and a 10 kWh battery storage. To optimize energy production even in the presence of shading or complex roof pitches, 10 TIGO power optimizers were installed.

The homeowner kindly shared his positive experience through a public review. In his testimony, he expressed appreciation for the preliminary consultation and the value for money offered. He also emphasized the professionalism and courtesy of the technicians during installation, highlighting their willingness to listen and accommodate specific requests, such as the need to carefully route cables to minimize their visibility.

The results achieved were particularly significant: the system functions perfectly and, as reported by the owner, has led to a drastic reduction in energy costs, with bills going from approximately €680 to just €69. With an estimated annual production of over 9,400 kWh, the system covers a large portion of the home's needs, avoiding the emission of approximately 60 tons of CO2 over 25 years (the equivalent of planting 368 trees). The project includes two years of routine maintenance and the adoption of a 3Bee hive for one year.

We are delighted to have contributed to these important results and to note the customer's satisfaction with the system installed.

Tipologia Description: Solar energy for a condominium with 5 private systems equipped with ZCS All-in-One storage and long-term services
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Shared Solar Energy: 5 Individual Photovoltaic Systems for a Condominium in Sesto San Giovanni

Text:

In a condominium located in Sesto San Giovanni (MI), Myenergy brought solar energy to five different resident families, demonstrating how individual photovoltaic solutions can be implemented even in a multi-unit context. Thanks to collaboration with the condominium administration, which issued the necessary authorization, five separate photovoltaic systems were installed on the shared roof. 

Each system was sized to meet the specific energy needs of each individual residential unit. Three 6.6 kWp systems (each with 15 Longi 440 Wp panels) and two 5.72 kWp systems (each with 13 Longi 440 Wp panels) were installed. All five systems use ZCS All-in-One technology, which compactly integrates the hybrid inverter and storage system. The battery capacities were customized: 10 kWh for two of the largest systems and 5 kWh for the other three.

Logistics management included coordination with the administrator and, for one of the units, the identification and authorized use of a suitable common area for installing the inverter/battery, ensuring safety and space constraints.

A significant added value for all five condominiums is the inclusion of a comprehensive long-term service package: 10 years of routine maintenance and 5 years of All Risk insurance coverage, for worry-free system management over time.

Overall, the five systems installed on the condominium's roof reach a total power of 31.24 kWp, with 71 panels and 35 kWh of total storage capacity, generating an estimated annual production of over 33,500 kWh of clean energy. This collective intervention, while maintaining the energy independence of each family, contributes to a significant reduction in the environmental impact of the entire building, equal to approximately 214 tons of CO2 avoided in 25 years (the equivalent of 1,308 trees).

Tipologia Description: Solar energy in Tuscany with a ZCS All-in-One integrated PV system and storage.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Integrated Energy Efficiency in Renovation in the Heart of Tuscany (Arezzo)

Text:

As part of the renovation of a single-family home located in Manciano, in the municipality of Castiglion Fiorentino (AR), Myenergy integrated a modern photovoltaic system with storage, designed to maximize the renovated home's energy efficiency.

A 6.25 kWp photovoltaic system, composed of 15 high-performance modules, was installed on the tiled roof. To optimize space and energy management, a ZCS All-in-One system was chosen, combining both a single-phase hybrid inverter and a 5 kWh storage battery in a single compact unit.

Thanks to the excellent solar exposure typical of Tuscany and the technology employed, the system is designed to achieve high annual production, estimated at over 7,200 kWh. The energy stored in the battery allows for home energy consumption to be covered even during the evening hours, significantly increasing self-consumption and independence from the electricity grid.

The installation, coordinated with the renovation phases, helps make the home not only more modern but also more sustainable. It is estimated that the system will avoid the emission of approximately 46 tons of CO2 over the next 25 years, with an environmental benefit comparable to planting 284 trees. The project is covered by two years of routine maintenance.

Tipologia Description: All-in-One ZCS residential system, a pioneer in Renewable Energy Communities (CER)
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Towards Shared Energy: Photovoltaic System in Seveso (MB) for the Energy Community

Text:

In Seveso (MB), Myenergy has built a cutting-edge residential photovoltaic system, designed not only to provide energy autonomy to individual homes but also as an active component of a nascent local Renewable Energy Community (CER). This project represents a significant step toward a shared and sustainable energy model for the area.

A powerful 8.30 kWp photovoltaic system, composed of 20 high-efficiency modules, was installed on the home's tiled roof. To optimize self-consumption and facilitate energy flow management for the CER, a compact ZCS All-in-One system was chosen. This unit integrates a 6 kW single-phase hybrid inverter and a 10.24 kWh storage battery, with the possibility of future expansion to over 20 kWh.

The storage system maximizes the use of on-site solar energy and opens the door to the benefits of clean energy sharing within the Energy Community. The project also included the installation of a permanent lifeline, ensuring maximum safety for future roof maintenance.

In addition to the individual benefits of savings and energy independence, this system allows the owner to actively contribute to their community's energy transition. With an estimated annual production of nearly 8,900 kWh, the system significantly reduces the home's carbon footprint (approximately 57 tons of CO2 avoided in 25 years, equivalent to planting 347 trees) and feeds clean energy into the local grid, benefiting the CER. The system is covered by two years of routine maintenance.
cer.desc:
Operational area in the municipalities of Barlassina, Cesano Maderno, Cogliate, Lentate sul Seveso, Meda, and Seveso.

Energy benefits for producers and consumers within this CER.

Tipologia Description: 6.6 kWp photovoltaic system with Huawei LUNA2000 storage system
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Huawei Photovoltaic System with Storage in Gorla Minore (VA): Customized Attic Solution

Text:

For a single-family home in Gorla Minore, in the province of Varese, Myenergy installed a photovoltaic system with storage designed to maximize self-consumption and energy savings.

Fifteen Longi 440Wp photovoltaic modules were installed on the building's tiled roof, for a total power output of 6.60 kWp. The system is managed by a Huawei single-phase inverter and is combined with a Huawei LUNA2000 10 kWh storage system, which stores excess solar energy for use when needed, even in the absence of sunlight.

During the site inspection and design phase, various options for positioning the inverter and batteries were evaluated, taking into account the specifics of the home and the client's preferences regarding cable routing. In consultation with the owner, the optimal solution was to install these components in the attic of the home, with the client's intention of further improving ventilation.

This system is capable of producing approximately 7,000 kWh of clean energy per year, covering a significant portion of the home's energy needs and significantly reducing grid consumption. It is estimated that over 25 years, the system will avoid the emission of nearly 45 tons of CO2, an environmental benefit equivalent to planting 274 trees. The project is covered by two years of routine maintenance.

Tipologia Description: PV system expanded to 6.56 kWp with ZCS All-in-One storage (15kWh total) and backup.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Maximum Energy Autonomy in Villanova (MB): PV System with 15 kWh of Storage and Backup

Text:

For a two-family house in Villanova (MB) with significant annual energy consumption (~5,200 kWh), Myenergy created a powerful and scalable photovoltaic solution, implemented in two phases to meet the owner's growing energy autonomy needs.

The initial project involved the installation of a 6.56 kWp photovoltaic system (16 x 410 Wp panels), combined with a compact ZCS All-in-One system with 10.24 kWh of integrated storage and the installation of a permanent lifeline for roof safety.

Subsequently, as planned with the client, the system was enhanced with the addition of a third 5.12 kWh battery module, bringing the total storage capacity to an exceptional 15.36 kWh, and the activation of the backup function. This configuration ensures extremely high independence from the electricity grid and continuity of power supply even in the event of a power outage.

The homeowner expressed complete satisfaction with the entire process in a 5-star review, complimenting the entire Myenergy team for their professionalism "from the estimate to the system's commissioning" and recommending the company "with all due respect."

With an estimated annual production of approximately 7,100 kWh, the system more than covers the home's consumption, minimizing grid draws thanks to its large storage capacity. The environmental impact is significant, with an estimated saving of approximately 45 tons of CO2 over 25 years (the equivalent of planting 276 trees).

Tipologia Description: ZCS All-in-One photovoltaic system with storage, backup, and lifeline for a terraced house.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Complete Photovoltaic Solution for a Terraced House in Novara: Storage, Backup, and Security

Text:

For a terraced house located in Novara (NO), Myenergy implemented a modern and comprehensive photovoltaic system, designed to increase energy independence and home security.

A 6.64 kWp photovoltaic system was installed on the tiled roof, consisting of 16 high-efficiency modules, secured with low-profile brackets for improved aesthetic integration. Energy management is handled by a compact ZCS All-in-One system, which integrates both a 6 kW single-phase hybrid inverter and a 5.12 kWh storage battery.

This system was equipped with backup functionality, essential for ensuring power supply to priority loads even in the event of a national power grid outage. Furthermore, the project included the installation of a permanent lifeline on the roof, an important safety feature during future maintenance operations.

Thanks to this configuration, the home can benefit from an estimated annual production of over 7,100 kWh of clean energy, maximizing self-consumption thanks to storage and ensuring operational continuity with the backup system. The positive environmental impact is significant, with approximately 45.5 tons of CO2 avoided over 25 years (equivalent to planting 279 trees). The system is covered by two years of routine maintenance.

Tipologia Description: Solar energy and storage for a two-family home, with wallbox and bird protection
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Complete Energy Solution for a Semi-detached House Under Renovation in San Biagio della Cima

Text:

During the renovation of a semi-detached building in San Biagio della Cima, in the province of Imperia, Myenergy installed two separate high-performance photovoltaic systems, designed to ensure maximum energy autonomy for each of the two residential units.

Both systems are identical and have a peak power of 8.36 kWp, generated by 19 high-efficiency photovoltaic panels. Each system is equipped with a hybrid inverter and a generous 10.24 kWh energy storage system, allowing solar energy produced during the day to be stored and used when needed, even at night, drastically reducing reliance on the electricity grid.

To meet sustainable mobility needs, each system was equipped with a 7.4 kW wallbox for home charging of electric vehicles. Furthermore, to protect the investment and ensure maximum panel life and cleanliness, a high-quality stainless steel bird barrier was installed around the perimeter of the photovoltaic modules.

The project in San Biagio della Cima, coordinated with the building's tiled roof renovation, is an example of Myenergy's widespread presence, capable of installing high-quality residential photovoltaic systems throughout Italy.

Overall, the two systems generate an estimated annual output of approximately 17,550 kWh of clean energy, significantly reducing energy costs for both families and making a significant environmental contribution, saving approximately 112 tons of CO2 over 25 years (equivalent to planting 684 trees). A complete and cutting-edge energy solution for a home projected towards the future.

Tipologia Description: Optimized 4.98 kWp PV system with ZCS All-in-One storage in the village of Villamaggiore
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Solar Energy for an Apartment in Borgo di Villamaggiore, Lacchiarella (MI)

Text:
Inside the "Borgo di Villamaggiore" residential complex in Lacchiarella (MI), Myenergy installed a photovoltaic system serving an apartment, taking advantage of the available shared roof.

The installed system has a power output of 5.28 kWp, generated by 12 photovoltaic modules (Longi Solar 440 Wp). To optimize energy management and self-consumption, a compact ZCS All-in-One solution was chosen, integrating both the 4 kW hybrid inverter and 5.12 kWh of battery storage. The system's performance is further enhanced by the presence of 12 power optimizers, one for each panel.

Particular attention was paid to the installation's durability and aesthetics: a bird barrier was included to protect the panels, and, upon request, external copper piping was used to run the cables, ensuring a meticulous finish.

This system, with an estimated annual production of over 5,700 kWh, allows the apartment to achieve a high degree of energy independence, reducing costs and environmental impact (approximately 34 tons of CO2 saved in 25 years, equivalent to 210 trees).

Tipologia Description: SolarEdge battery system in Lissone (MB): 7.04 kWp new integrated into existing system for fully electric home
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Optimized Solar Energy in the Historic Center of Lissone: PV Expansion with SolarEdge and Storage

Text:

In a characteristic renovated courtyard in the historic center of Lissone (MB), Myenergy completed a significant energy efficiency upgrade for an all-electric home, aimed at managing high energy consumption. The project involved the expansion of a small existing photovoltaic system (1.20 kWp).

7.04 kWp of new, high-efficiency photovoltaic panels were installed, complementing the three existing modules (for a total of 1.20 kWp). The main challenge was positioning the panels in a historic center context subject to specific regulations. Myenergy combined compliance with municipal regulations with the pursuit of maximum efficiency: through constructive dialogue with the municipal technical offices, it was possible to obtain approval to use the most suitable roof slopes, including the one facing the street, thus ensuring the best possible positioning for energy production.

To best manage the integration between new and existing panels and optimize the performance of each individual module, SolarEdge technology was chosen. The system uses a 6 kW SolarEdge single-phase inverter and power optimizers installed on each of the 19 panels. Thanks to this technology, the three existing panels were electrically integrated into the new system without having to be physically moved.

To complete the system, a 9.7 kWh SolarEdge Energy Bank storage battery was installed, essential for storing the energy produced and using it during the evening or nighttime hours, thus covering the needs of the "all-electric" home.

The project, which also required condominium approval, was carried out on a tiled roof. The new 7.04 kWp portion of the plant will produce approximately 7,550 kWh of clean energy annually, contributing to a drastic reduction in utility bills and an estimated environmental saving of approximately 48 tons of CO2 over 25 years (the equivalent of planting 295 trees). This is an example of how technical expertise and dialogue with institutions can lead to optimal energy solutions even in complex contexts.

Tipologia Description: Energy efficiency in Castelfranco Emilia: Huawei 6.64 kWp PV system + 5 kWh battery on a terraced house
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Huawei Photovoltaic System with Storage for a Terraced House in Castelfranco Emilia

Text:

For a terraced house located in Castelfranco Emilia (MO), Myenergy installed a photovoltaic system with storage sized to meet the energy needs of the home, built in 2004.

The system, positioned on the tiled roof, has a peak power of 6.64 kWp, achieved through the installation of 16 photovoltaic modules (JA Solar 415Wp). Energy management is handled by a Huawei system, consisting of a 5 kW single-phase inverter (with storage capability) and a 5 kWh LUNA2000 battery. This configuration maximizes the use of solar energy produced, storing any unused energy during the day to make it available in the evening or nighttime.

The system is designed to generate approximately 7,300 kWh of clean energy per year, significantly reducing grid consumption and lowering utility bills. The positive environmental impact is estimated to be a saving of approximately 47 tons of CO2 over 25 years, equivalent to the benefits of 286 trees. The project includes two years of routine maintenance. An efficient and well-sized solution for energy independence for a modern townhouse.

Tipologia Description: Energy solutions for a semi-detached house: two 5.28 kWp PV systems, one with a ZCS storage system and a full-electric Immergas heat pump.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Tailored Efficiency for a Semi-Detached House in Meda: Photovoltaic, Storage, and Fully Electric Heat Pump

Text:

For a semi-detached house located in Meda (MB), Myenergy developed and installed two separate energy systems, customized to the specific needs of each unit, demonstrating flexibility in integrating different technologies.

Two photovoltaic systems of equal power, each 5.28 kWp, were installed, consisting of twelve 440 Wp high-efficiency panels, ensuring a solid foundation for renewable energy production for the building.

The downstream configurations, however, were differentiated:

One of the residential units was equipped with a single 5.28 kWp photovoltaic system and its associated ZCS inverter, optimized for direct solar energy production and self-consumption.
For the other unit, a more complex integrated solution was implemented: the 5.28 kWp photovoltaic system was combined with a ZCS All-in-One system, which includes 5.12 kWh of battery storage. At the same time, Myenergy also installed a full-electric Immergas heat pump (12 kW Magis Pro V2 model) complete with hydronic split units, creating an advanced, all-electric system for air conditioning and domestic hot water production, maximizing the use of self-generated energy thanks to the storage.
This dual project highlights the ability to provide customized energy solutions, from simple photovoltaic installation to full integration with electric heating and storage systems. Overall, the two PV systems produce approximately 11,300 kWh of clean energy per year, contributing to a significant reduction in energy costs and the building's emissions (approximately 72 tons of CO2 avoided in 25 years, the equivalent of planting 440 trees).

Tipologia Description: Energy requalification in Borgo San Giovanni (LO): 5.28 kWp Huawei PV with battery, optimizers, and solar thermal removal
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Energy Renovation in Borgo San Giovanni (LO): New Huawei Photovoltaic System with Storage Replaces Solar Thermal

Text:

In Borgo San Giovanni, in the province of Lodi, Myenergy completed a complete energy retrofit project for a private residence. The project included not only the installation of a modern photovoltaic system with storage, but also the removal of an existing, obsolete solar thermal system.

A 5.28 kWp photovoltaic system was installed on the tiled roof, consisting of 12 high-efficiency Longi 440 Wp modules. To optimize the energy production of each panel, 12 power optimizers were used. Energy management is handled by a Huawei system, which includes a single-phase inverter and a LUNA2000 5 kWh storage battery, allowing solar energy to be used even after sunset. To protect the investment, a bird barrier was also installed.

The project was completed by carefully dismantling the old solar thermal system, freeing up roof space and updating the home's energy infrastructure. The package includes scheduled maintenance to be completed within five years.

This system is designed to produce approximately 5,700 kWh of clean electricity per year, covering a significant portion of the home's consumption and reducing its environmental impact (approximately 36 tons of CO2 avoided over 25 years, equivalent to 223 trees). A comprehensive solution that improves the home's energy efficiency and autonomy.

Tipologia Description: Forward-thinking energy solution in Casteggio (PV): 8.8 kWp PV + 15 kWh Huawei battery and wallbox included
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Investment in the Energy Future in Casteggio (PV): 8.8 kWp Photovoltaic System with 15 kWh of Huawei Storage

Text:

For a single-family home in Casteggio, in the province of Pavia, Myenergy has installed a photovoltaic system sized not only for current needs but also for the future complete electrification of the home. The owner has expressed his intention to install a heat pump and purchase an electric vehicle in the near future.

Twenty photovoltaic modules (Longi 440 Wp) have been installed on the building's pitched roof, generating a peak power of 8.80 kWp, capable of generating a significant amount of energy. Management is entrusted to a Huawei system, including a 6 kW single-phase inverter and, key to the project, a large-capacity LUNA2000 storage system with a capacity of 15 kWh (composed of three battery modules). This significant energy reserve was chosen to ensure maximum consumption coverage even when the significant loads of the heat pump and electric vehicle are added.

To complete the sustainable mobility setup, the system also includes a complimentary 7.4 kW wallbox, ready for home charging. Installation was also facilitated by the presence of pre-installed cable routing throughout the home.

This system, with an estimated annual production of over 9,500 kWh, not only more than covers current consumption but also lays the foundation for near-total energy independence in the future. The environmental impact is significant, with approximately 61 tons of CO2 avoided over 25 years (equal to the effect of 374 trees). The project includes two years of routine maintenance. A strategic choice for an efficient and sustainable energy future.

Tipologia Description: Safety and autonomy in Peschiera Borromeo (MI): 6.23 kWp PV + 10 kWh Huawei battery, with backup and lifeline
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Complete and Secure Energy Solution in Peschiera Borromeo: Huawei PV with Storage, Backup, and Lifeline

Text:

For a private home in Peschiera Borromeo (MI), Myenergy has created a complete photovoltaic system, designed to offer not only energy efficiency but also maximum safety and service continuity.

The system installed on the tiled roof has a power output of 6.23 kWp, generated by 15 photovoltaic modules (JA Solar 415Wp). The system is equipped with 15 power optimizers, one for each panel, to maximize individual and overall production. Energy management is handled by Huawei technology, with a 5 kW single-phase inverter and a LUNA2000 10 kWh storage system, which ensures solar energy availability even at night.

A key element of this project is the integration of a backup system, capable of powering the home's essential loads even in the event of a national grid outage, providing peace of mind and security. For long-term safety, a permanent lifeline was also installed on the roof, allowing for safe future maintenance. Finally, copper piping was chosen for the external cables, ensuring a refined and long-lasting aesthetic finish.

This system produces approximately 6,670 kWh of clean energy each year, drastically reducing grid dependence and energy costs. Its environmental impact is significant, with an estimated saving of approximately 42.5 tons of CO2 over 25 years (equivalent to the effect of planting 260 trees).

Tipologia Description: Combined intervention in Bubbiano (MI): Huawei 8.8 kWp PV + 10 kWh battery, optimizers, condensing boiler and lifeline.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Integrated Energy Renovation in Bubbiano (MI): Photovoltaic with Storage and New Condensing Boiler

Text:

In Bubbiano, in the province of Milan, Myenergy completed a complete energy retrofit for a single-family home, combining the installation of an advanced photovoltaic system with the replacement of the heating system, optimizing access to various tax incentives.

A powerful 8.80 kWp photovoltaic system was installed, consisting of 20 modules (Longi 440 Wp). To maximize the energy yield of each panel, 20 power optimizers were used. The Huawei energy management system includes a 6 kW single-phase inverter and a 10 kWh LUNA2000 storage system, ensuring ample availability of self-generated solar energy. This component of the project benefited from the 50% tax deduction for building renovations.

At the same time, to improve the home's thermal efficiency, the old boiler was replaced with a modern 30 kW Immergas Victrix Zeus Superior condensing model, and 12 new thermostatic valves were installed for better heat regulation. This specific intervention was eligible for the 65% Ecobonus.

After completing the roof work, a permanent lifeline was installed to ensure safety.

This integrated approach ensures a significant reduction in the home's overall energy consumption. The photovoltaic system, with an estimated annual production of nearly 9,500 kWh, reduces electricity costs, while the new boiler optimizes heating costs. The positive environmental impact translates into a saving of approximately 60.5 tons of CO2 over 25 years (equivalent to planting 370 trees).

This combined intervention, likely implemented through tax deductions for energy efficiency, allows for optimal management of the home's energy consumption. The photovoltaic system is estimated to produce almost 9,500 kWh per year, drastically reducing dependence on the electricity grid and environmental impact (approximately 60.5 tons of CO2 avoided in 25 years, the equivalent of planting 370 trees).

Saline Joniche (RC): 8.5 kWp high-yield residential photovoltaic system for self-consumption and grid feed-in.
descdettailed:
Proposed Title: Maximum Energy Efficiency in Saline Joniche (RC): 8.5 kWp High-Production Residential Photovoltaic System

Text:

In Saline Joniche, in the province of Reggio Calabria, Myenergy—a company that has always been close to the local community and a proud supporter of Viola Reggio Calabria, the city's historic basketball team—has installed a residential photovoltaic system designed to maximize clean energy production and increase the customer's energy independence.

Taking advantage of excellent solar exposure, a photovoltaic system with a total output of 8.5 kWp was installed on the home's roof. The design focused on optimizing yield, without the inclusion of storage systems, to meet the customer's need for an efficient investment that focuses on covering daily consumption and maximizing excess energy production by feeding it directly into the grid.

This system is capable of producing an average of nearly 9,800 kWh of clean energy per year (calculated on an estimated total production of 244.19 MWh over 25 years). This production fully covers the home's daytime energy consumption, drastically reducing reliance on the national electricity grid and maximizing energy bill savings.

The investment not only generates significant economic benefits, estimated at approximately €29,067.68 over 25 years, but also makes a tangible contribution to environmental sustainability. It is estimated that over its useful life, the system will prevent the emission of over 62 tons of CO2 into the atmosphere, a result comparable to the environmental benefit generated by planting 373 trees.

With this project, Myenergy confirms its commitment to providing customized, efficient, and cost-effective energy solutions, consolidating its presence and contribution to the sustainable development of the Calabrian region.
